alert.note: Alert for Western Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued September 28 at 9:03AM AKDT until September 30 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 60 to 80 mph with gusts up to 100 mph expected. * WHERE...Western Aleutians. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to 4 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris and may damage property. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A potent storm system, the remnants of current Typhoon Kulap, is expected to enter the Western Bering and Aleutians on Thursday. Southeast winds are expected to increase Thursday morning and then shift southwest late Thursday night, continuing through at least Friday afternoon. The highest winds are currently expected near Attu and Shemya early Friday morning, where gusts to 100 mph are expected. Widespread sustained winds are expected to be around 60 to 80 mph with the strongest southeast winds Friday morning.
info.instruction: Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
